quiz.subtitle: 7.7: Single Replacement (Displacement) Reactions
quiz.subject: Chemistry

questions.question: A single replacement reaction is a chemical change in which:
options: One element replaces a second element in a compound.
Two elements combine to form one new compound.
A single compound breaks down into two elements.
Two compounds exchange ions to form two new compounds.
questions.explanation: In a single replacement reaction, a more reactive element displaces a less reactive element from its compound, following the form $A + BC \rightarrow AC + B$.

questions.question: Which of the following equations represents a single replacement reaction?
questions.explanation: Zinc (an element) replaces Copper in the compound Copper(II) chloride.

questions.question: What determines whether one metal will replace another metal in a single replacement reaction?
options: The atomic mass of the metals
The number of neutrons in the nucleus
questions.explanation: A metal can only replace another metal that is lower than itself on the Activity Series (less reactive).

questions.question: In the potential reaction $Cu(s) + Mg(NO_{3})_{2}(aq) \rightarrow$ , what will occur?
options: Magnesium will turn into a gas.
Copper will dissolve and form a precipitate.
questions.explanation: According to the activity series, Copper is less reactive than Magnesium and therefore cannot displace it from a compound.

questions.question: When a halogen like Chlorine ($Cl_{2}$) reacts with a compound like Potassium Bromide ($KBr$), what is produced?
questions.explanation: Chlorine is more reactive than Bromine (higher in Group 17), so it replaces the Bromine: $Cl_{2} + 2KBr \rightarrow 2KCl + Br_{2}$.

questions.question: Active metals (like Sodium) react with water in a single replacement reaction to produce:
options: A metal hydroxide and Hydrogen gas
A metal oxide and Oxygen gas
questions.explanation: The reaction $2Na + 2H_{2}O \rightarrow 2NaOH + H_{2}$ shows the metal displacing one hydrogen atom from the water molecule.

questions.question: Which general pattern identifies a single replacement reaction?
questions.explanation: This pattern shows a lone element 'kicking out' an element from a compound to take its place.

questions.question: If Magnesium is added to Hydrochloric acid ($HCl$), which gas is produced?
questions.explanation: Magnesium replaces the Hydrogen in the acid: $Mg + 2HCl \rightarrow MgCl_{2} + H_{2}$.

questions.question: Which of these halogens is the MOST reactive and can replace any other halogen from a compound?
questions.explanation: Reactivity for halogens decreases as you go down the group; Fluorine is at the top and is the most reactive.

questions.question: In a single replacement reaction where a nonmetal is the lone reactant (A), what does it replace in compound BC?
options: The nonmetal (anion) part of the compound
The metal (cation) part of the compound
questions.explanation: Nonmetals replace nonmetals (like-replaces-like). Therefore, a lone nonmetal will swap places with the anion in the compound.
